input_text.Prompt: Can you tell me how to spot an online scam?
input_text.Response A: Sure, I can help you.  If you want to protect yourself, you can use a few basic principles.  First, you should be aware of any “scammers” who are trying to trick you into giving them money or information.  There are lots of different types of scammers, but some of the most common are people who try to get you to pay money for something you don’t actually want or need.  Or they try to trick you into giving them information about yourself that they can use to steal your identity.  So you should be careful about what information you give out, and you should be careful about how you give it out.
input_text.Response B: There are several ways to spot an online scam. Some signs to look out for include: 1) unsolicited emails or phone calls requesting personal information, 2) promises of easy money with little to no work, 3) requests for payment or wire transfers, 4) phishing websites that steal your personal information, and 5) pressure to act quickly without time to research the company or offer. Always do your due diligence and trust your instincts when it comes to online transactions.

label_annotations.factors_a: Response A is very good but is more of a flowing conversation unlike response B
label_annotations.factors_b: Response B is clear and concise in the way it makes bullet points compared to response A, however there was a lack of capital letters at the beginning of each point, for example ( 1 Unsolicited emails)
